xml.brief: Retrieve information on a single cacheset

opt.name: langpref
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of ISO 639-1 language codes. This indicates the order of preference in which language will be chosen for fields like name and description.
Please note, that you may also access paths' descriptions in all available languages. If you want to do this, you should use fields names, descriptions (etc.) instead of name and description (etc.).

opt.name: fields
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of field names which you are interested with. Selected fields will be included in the response. See below for the list of available fields.

returns.p: A dictionary of fields you have selected. Currently available fields:

ul.li: uuid - unique ID of the cacheset.
name - name of the cacheset.
names - a dictionary (language code => plain-text string) of cacheset names (at this time, there will be only one language, but this may change in future).

li.p: location - location of the cacheset in the "lat|lon" format (lat and lon are in full degrees with a dot as a decimal point).

Cachesets consist of many geocaches, so it's usually not possible to assign a single, good location to a path. The location returned here is the same one we use to display cachesets on the map. It will usually point to the center of the area in which the path's geocaches are located, but this may change in the future.
type - path type. This might be pretty much everything, but there are some predefined types that you might want to treat in a special way (separate icons etc.). Primary types include:

ul.li: Geodraw,
Touring,
Nature,
Thematic,

li.p: status - path status. Valid cacheset status codes currently include:

ul.li: Available - cacheset is available and ready to be WRTODOed,
Temporarily unavailable - cacheset is currently unavailable (it cannot be WRTODOed) but it will probably be restored soon,
Archived - cacheset permanently unavailable (moved to the archives).
uuid - cacheset mentor's user ID,
username - name of the user,
profile_url - URL of the user profile page.
authors - a list of authors. Each element of this list has the same structure as the mentor element described above.
url - URL of the path's web page.
image_url - an URL of the "main" image of this cacheset (e.g. a logo or a photo related to the path's topic), or null if no such photo has been assigned.
description - HTML string, description of the cacheset.
descriptions - a dictionary (language code => HTML string) of cacheset descriptions.
geocaches_total - number of geocaches currently present on this cacheset.

li.p: geocaches_found - number of geocaches already found by the user.
You will need Level 3 Authentication to access this field.
geocaches_found_ratio - float, ratio of geocaches already found by the user, e.g. 0.333333 means that the user has found one third of the geocaches on this cacheset.
If geocaches_total is zero, then this ratio will also be zero.

ul.li: min_founds_to_complete - minimum number of geocaches which a user needs to find in order to be eligible to claim this cacheset as "completed" WRTODO: or 0 if user has enough founds?
min_ratio_to_complete - minimum ratio of found/total geocaches which a user needs to have in order to be eligible to claim this cacheset as "completed".

li.p: my_completed_status - indicates the status of this cacheset from the user's perspective. It has one of the following values:

ul.li: not_eligable - if the user has not completed this path, and he didn't find a proper number of its geocaches to be eligable to claim this cacheset as completed,
eligable - if the user has already found a proper minimum number of geocaches, but he didn't claim the "completed" status yet,
completed - if the user has (once) found a proper minimum number of geocaches and claimed the "completed" status.

li.p: You will need Level 3 Authentication to access this field.

Note, that due to possible changes in the number of geocaches and the requirements in the minimum number of found caches, the user may end up with both the "completed" status, and geocaches_found_ratio less than 1.0.

ul.li: completed_count - number of times the path has been successfully completed (by all users).
last_completed - date and time (ISO 8601) when the cacheset has been last completed, or null if it hasn't been yet completed by anyone.
date_created - date and time (ISO 8601) when the cacheset was first published at the Opencaching site.
gplog_uuids - list of UUIDs of all log entries of this cacheset. The logs are ordered chronologically - latest logs will be on the end of this list.
